item.title: How Much Does Blue Prince Cost? Is it Free to Play?
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/how-much-does-blue-prince-cost-is-it-free-to-play/

Whether you are on PlayStation 5, PC, or Xbox Series X, here is everything you need to know about the cost of Blue Prince and whether the game is free.

Game prices are a hotly contested topic at the moment. Nintendo fans were shocked when it was revealed that Switch 2 games cost $80 instead of $60, as seen on the first Switch console. Nintendo defended the decision by arguing that it was due to the game’s value to players.

Additionally, physical Switch 2 games cost more than digital and will cost up to $98 when converted from Euros. This is, of course, in addition to the console itself, which is expected to cost $450 or more. Playing video games has always been a rather expensive hobby, but not all titles are increasing in price, as is the case with Blue Prince.

How Much Does Blue Prince Cost?

According to the Dogubomb community manager, Blue Prince costs $29.99 / €29.99 / £24.99 on PlayStation 5, Steam, and Xbox.

Players can purchase the game digitally on Steam, PlayStation Store, and Microsoft Store. Blue Prince will not be available physically, and there is only one edition, meaning there aren’t any pre-order bonuses or early access.

Blue Prince will not be available on the Epic Games Store or GOG at launch. Dogubomb revealed that the game will be Steam Deck compatible, but that won’t be until a later date.

Is Blue Prince Free to Play?

Blue Prince is not free to play, but it is available as a day-one release on PlayStation Plus Extra and Xbox Game Pass Ultimate.

An Xbox Game Pass Ultimate subscription costs $19.99 a month, and it will set you back $14.99 a month to become a PlayStation Plus Extra member.

Blue Prince isn’t the only game coming to PlayStation Plus in April. The fresh batch of PlayStation Plus Extra upcoming titles includes the likes of Hogwarts Legacy, EA Sports PGA Tour, and Battlefield 1.

As for Xbox Game Pass Ultimate, South of Midnight and Clair Obscur Expedition 33 are both day-one releases for the service. And if that wasn’t already enough, GTA 5 is also coming to Game Pass on April 15.

What else can fans expect from Blue Prince? Check out the game’s release date, achievements, and trophies, as well as the list of platforms it will be on. It’s still too early to tell without having a chance to play, but first impressions from reviewers have been overwhelmingly positive.

What are you most excited about to try out first in Blue Prince? If you manage to reach Room 46 before everyone else, make sure to share your story on the Insider Gaming Forums.

item.title: Latest Titanfall 3 Rumors “Not Real”, According To Jeff Grubb
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/latest-titanfall-3-rumors-not-real-according-to-jeff-grubb/

Don’t get your hopes up for Titanfall 3 just yet. After a leak came out suggesting that Titanfall 3 is “almost complete” along with a number of planned features, one prominent journalist has publicly reported that none of the leaked information is accurate.

In the latest episode of Game Breaking News, Jeff Grubb shot down the claims by Apex Legends leaker Osvaldatore.

“This isn’t real,” Grubb said. “I’m sorry. It’s not real.”

Grubb then went on to talk about Respawn having a small team that is “probably messing around with games that have titans in them”.

“Does he ( Titanfall 1 director Steve Fukuda) have something like a prototype that has titans in it? I would guess so,” Grubb added. “I don’t know for sure, but I would certainly assume that that is a safe thing to think.

“Now, is that going to get announced in 2025 and released in 2026? No way.”

READ MORE: Xbox Games Showcase Announced For June 8, 2025

He then touched on the fact that EA has been on a trend of canceling various games at Respawn. Those cancellations include Titanfall Legends which was a “previous version of Titanfall 3”.

“Do not expect an Unreal Engine 5, single player campaign Titanfall 3 with a full multiplayer suite,” Grubb said while saying he hated being the one to rain on the parade. “I’m not sure where this is coming from…don’t get your hopes up for Titanfall anytime soon.”

Do you think EA and Respawn will ever release a Titanfall 3? Let us know down below, and join the discussion in the official Insider Gaming forums.

For more Insider Gaming, read about what Nintendo of America’s president had to say to people who might not be able to afford a Nintendo Switch 2. And don’t forget to sign up for the Insider Gaming newsletter.
